1.text: My son, forget not my law; but let your heart keep my commandments:

2.text: For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to you.

3.text: Let not mercy and truth forsake you: bind them about your neck; write them on the table of your heart:

4.text: So shall you find favor and good understanding in the sight of God and man.

5.text: Trust in the LORD with all your heart; and lean not to your own understanding.

6.text: In all your ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct your paths.

7.text: Be not wise in your own eyes: fear the LORD, and depart from evil.

8.text: It shall be health to your navel, and marrow to your bones.

9.text: Honor the LORD with your substance, and with the first fruits of all your increase:

10.text: So shall your barns be filled with plenty, and your presses shall burst out with new wine.

11.text: My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD; neither be weary of his correction:

12.text: For whom the LORD loves he corrects; even as a father the son in whom he delights.

13.text: Happy is the man that finds wisdom, and the man that gets understanding.

14.text: For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.

15.text: She is more precious than rubies: and all the things you can desire are not to be compared to her.

16.text: Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honor.

17.text: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.

18.text: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold on her: and happy is every one that retains her.

19.text: The LORD by wisdom has founded the earth; by understanding has he established the heavens.

20.text: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.

21.text: My son, let not them depart from your eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:

22.text: So shall they be life to your soul, and grace to your neck.

23.text: Then shall you walk in your way safely, and your foot shall not stumble.

24.text: When you lie down, you shall not be afraid: yes, you shall lie down, and your sleep shall be sweet.

25.text: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it comes.

26.text: For the LORD shall be your confidence, and shall keep your foot from being taken.

27.text: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of your hand to do it.

28.text: Say not to your neighbor, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when you have it by you.

29.text: Devise not evil against your neighbor, seeing he dwells securely by you.

30.text: Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done you no harm.

31.text: Envy you not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.

32.text: For the fraudulent is abomination to the LORD: but his secret is with the righteous.

33.text: The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked: but he blesses the habitation of the just.

34.text: Surely he scorns the scorners: but he gives grace to the lowly.

35.text: The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.
